page.title: 17GOVERNMENT IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: The Trelawnyd and Gwaenysgor Community Council has been in existence since 1984. It meets monthly, alternatively in each village. The high average age of the residents a third of the voters being over 65 years, is reflected in there being only one councillor under 50 years of age, with the average age of the members being 63. Although the meetings are open, invariable unless an item on the Agenda affects someone personally, the public does not attend. The agenda being drawn up by the Chairman and Clerk, and the minutes of the meetings are not published. Most of the members are bilingual, but meetings have been conducted in English since the amalgamation of the villages. The clerk considers the main concern are street lighting,burial ground,and Hall
